justification: The review refers to the IAT as “the workhorse method for studying ‘implicit bias,’” indicating that this construct is operationalized with the Implicit Association Test.

When describing Kahan et al. (2016) the article states, “One result compared people high or low in their Cultural Cognition Worldview Scale (which correlated with left/right politics),” showing the scale is used to measure the worldview construct.

The authors introduce the GJI as “a mathematical tool for extracting information about unbiased responding from studies focusing exclusively on bias,” explicitly presenting it as a quantitative measure of judgmental bias versus accuracy.
Peyton & Huber (2021) are summarized as having “used the ultimatum game to test for anti-Black discrimination,” identifying the game as the measurement tool for racial discrimination.

The meta-analysis by Schaerer et al. (2023) examined “85 audit studies… whether otherwise equivalent men or women were more likely to receive a callback,” indicating that audit-study callback rates serve as the measure of gender discrimination.
